citation.article-title: Thalassospira lucentensis gen. nov., sp. nov., a new marine member of the alpha-Proteobacteria.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Thalassospira (Tha.las'so.spi.ra. Gr. fem. n. thalassa the sea; Gr. fem. n. spira a spire ; N.L. fem. n. Thalassospira spiral-shaped organism from the sea)
Gram-negative, vibrioid to spiral cells 3-5 μm long by 0.6 μm wide, each motile by one polar flagellum.
Chemoheterotrophic, strictly aerobic, and unable to grow under anaerobic conditions either by fermentation, nitrate reduction or photoheterotrophy.
It also grows at very low nutrient concentrations (facultative oligotroph).
Ammonia and nitrate may serve as nitrogen sources.
Uses carbohydrates, organic acids or amino acids as sole carbon sources for growth.
Strictly halophilic, requires Na ions for growth.
The principal cellular fatty acids are C18:1-cisω7 (45%), C16:0 (16%) and C16:1-cisω7 (16%).
According to the 16S rRNA sequence, the isolate belongs to the α-subclass of the Proteobacteria.
Phylogenetically, it belongs to the Rhodospirillaceae family of the α-Proteobacteria group.
